definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: My gaze fell to the nape of his neck where my hand is.
sentences.chinese: 我的手搂着他的脖子，目光注视着他的颈背。

sentences.english: Conclusion Massage therapy has excellent effectiveness in the treatment of nape and back pain in lactation.
sentences.chinese: 结论推拿疗法治疗哺乳性颈背疼痛症疗效显著。

sentences.english: Eric indicated that he had an accident in wakeboarding and had a neck and back pain.
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威表示日前滑水时遇意外令颈背受伤。

sentences.english: Reaching over the arm of my chair I shake Manfred by the scruff of his neck.
sentences.chinese: 扶着椅子的扶手，我摇了摇曼弗雷德的颈背。

sentences.english: She tied her long hair in a bow at the nape of her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她将长发在颈背处扎成一个蝴蝶结。

sentences.english: Objective To observe the clinical efficacy of massage therapy for nape and back pain in lactation.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察推拿治疗哺乳性颈背疼痛症的临床疗效。

sentences.english: Three-Chop liked a clear expanse of neck with which to work.
sentences.chinese: 三刀断喜欢跟清楚明白的后颈背打交道。

sentences.english: I grabbed the little boy by the scruff of the neck and bundled him out of the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 我抓住那小男孩的颈背，把他撵出了教室。

definition: the back of the human body
back (of a human or other vertebrate)
